page.title: 07CHEDDAR RECREATION - ANGLING
page.content: There are many recreatioal activities in Cheddar including football,rugby, badminton,hockey,judo,karate,cricket, swimming,tennis and one of the most popular,ANGLING. The River Yeo runs through Cheddar and although there are trout in it,fishing is not allowed by Bristol Waterworks. Fishing is allowed in the Reservoir, the Claypits and the Hixham Rhyne.All the waterways are looked after by the Wessex Water Board,but the fishing areas are administered by the Cheddar Angling Club.They keep the water stocked with fish and control the fishing.The types that are caught are trout,pike,eels,carp,roach,tench and perch.The largest caught was a 26 pound carp.Fishing is not allowed during the breeding season.Coarse fishing rods are used with baits of maggots,worms,deadbait or cheese.
